modules.description: This module handles network communication for IRC clients using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It provides functions to connect to IRC servers, send and receive messages, and manage socket connections. It works with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and is used to establish and maintain real-time IRC chat sessions.

This module implements IRC client functionality with Lwt for asynchronous I/O, handling connection state through the `connection_t` type and supporting automatic reconnection and keepalive management. It provides functions to send IRC commands like JOIN, PRIVMSG, and PONG, and to react to incoming messages, enabling use cases such as IRC bots or persistent chat clients. The network submodule manages socket communication, supporting IPv4 and IPv6 to establish and maintain real-time connections. Together, they allow building robust IRC clients that can send messages, join channels, and handle server interactions seamlessly.
